the very best arguments

the story of Job is one

he's a good righteous

Go forward many centuries
to Thomas Aquinas:

when Thomas sets up the
question, 'Does God exist?'

If one of two contraries be infinite,

the other would be
altogether destroyed.

So if there were infinite
heat, there'd be nothing cold-

but God is described as
'infinitely good.'

Therefore, if God exists

Therefore God doesn't exist.
That's a darn good argument.

Dostoevsky was a deeply
believing Christian.

And yet he puts on the
lips of his character,
Ivan Karamazov,
this awful argument against God.

And Ivan is trying to
convince his brother Alyosha
who had been a monk,

and was a devoutly
mystical, religious person.

And he says,
"Look at all these examples
of innocent children

being tortured, in some
cases, tortured to death."

I mean read that, and it's
as convincing as anything.
So three believers-

the author of Job, Thomas
Aquinas, and Dostoevsky-
all lay out this argument,

much evil in the world,

let's face it, there
can't be an all-good God.
These are very good arguments against God.

the atheists have-
is the argument from evil.
Thomas Aquinas says,

"God is so good that he
permits certain evils,
